name: jungle
content:
jungle noun
(FOREST)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B1 [ C or U ] a tropical forest in which trees and plants grow very closely together: The Yanomami people live in the South American jungle. Either side of the river is dense, impenetrable jungle.
Ippei Naoi/Moment/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesWe landed at a tiny airstrip in the middle of the jungle.He spent a year in the jungle, observing how deforestation is affecting local tribes.She gave a thrilling account of her life in the jungle.A gravel road leads through the jungle and up into the Andes.The lion is often called the king of the jungle.

jungle noun
(UNTIDY PLACE)
[ S ] an uncontrolled or confusing mass of things: Our garden is a real jungle. a jungle of electronic equipment

jungle noun
(SITUATION)
[ S ] informal a situation in which it is difficult to succeed because a lot of people are competing against each other: You've got to be determined in this life - it's a jungle out there, kid.

jungle noun
(MUSIC)
[ U ] a type of popular dance music with an extremely fast rhythm and a low range of musical notes
